intro: Pilocarpus spicatus var. peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian jurema, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange aril. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its use in traditional herbal remedies.
